definition: to exceed/to overtake/to surpass/to transcend/to pass/to cross/ultra-/super-
can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy

sentences.english: One superpower all psychologists would kill for is the ability to read minds.
sentences.chinese: “读心术”是每个心理学家都梦寐以求的超能力。

sentences.english: And they, too, are thought to have superhuman powers when it comes to making money.
sentences.chinese: 当谈到挣钱时，他们也被当做是拥有超能力的异类。

sentences.english: At night, it levitates rocks with psychic power and maps the position of the stars.
sentences.chinese: 晚上它用超能力使石头漂起来，制造星图。

sentences.english: I possess superpowers cultivated through careful study and dedicated practice.
sentences.chinese: 通过自己研究和潜心练习，我拥有了超能力。

sentences.english: What would your super power be?
There's nothing inherently supernatural about sin.
sentences.chinese: 罪恶没有什么内在的超能力。

sentences.english: If you had one super power what would it be?
sentences.chinese: 如果你有超能力你想拥有哪种？

sentences.english: There's no guarantee all will use superhuman abilities for good.
sentences.chinese: 因为并不能保证人人都会把超能力用于好的方面。

sentences.english: If you could have one super-power, what would it be?
sentences.chinese: 如果给你一项超能力，你希望是什么？

sentences.english: Ghosts can have many human traits and may have some superpowers, too.
sentences.chinese: 鬼魂可以有许多人的特性以及也可能产生一些超能力。

sentences.english: Perhaps the color of this alien sun has given you superpowers.
sentences.chinese: 这里太阳的光芒可能会赋予你超能力。

sentences.english: It is dishonest to claim psychic ability when the details are revealed by plain, natural astrology.
sentences.chinese: 将朴素自然的占星术虚张为超能力这是不诚实的。

definition: sixth sense (i.e. intuition, premonition, telepathy etc)
